title: The DUP's real fear? That its position as a key player in Northern Ireland is under threat
text:
It’s highly likely that today Westminster will impose legalised abortion and gay marriage on Northern Ireland. This encapsulates what’s gone wrong for the Democratic Unionist Party – a party that until recently held the balance of power, but now sees history slipping through its fingers. I think it helps explain some of its fears regarding the new Brexit deal.

Abortion and marriage are supposed to be devolved matters decided by the Stormont Assembly. A majority of assembly members voted for gay marriage in 2015: no matter because, under the terms of the Good Friday Agreement, the DUP, the largest unionist party, was able to veto it.
